title: Data Analyst
description: Role: Data Analyst Location New York Onsite from day one Long Term Contract Responsibilities - • Apply expertise in quantitative analysis and statistical analysis to formulate deep-level insights that help identify trends & opportunities to drive growth of our business, and measure impact. • Designs interconnected collections of high-performance visualizations that enable clear narrative understanding as well as deeper, interactive exploration. • Be a thought leader for data-informed initiatives and contribute to the team’s direction overall. • Conduct in-depth investigations leveraging large and complex data sets. • Partner with Project Managers, Data Science, Product teams to solve problems at scale. • Inform, influence, and execute new strategies and tactics using analysis and impact metrics. • Determines success metrics that measure short and long-term progress for both goal and project performance. • Build narrative around data quality and provide insights that will help in better annotation project performance opportunities. • Handle relational and non- relational databases, data frames and/or Business Intelligence development, performing data transformations and data manipulation. • Design and develop data solutions that help the team and leadership make data driven analytical decisions tailored to improve the business. • Leverage appropriate analytical techniques to draw conclusions from structured and unstructured data and answer exploratory and hypothesis-based questions that inform data-driven decisions. Minimum Qualifications - • Degree in Business Analytics, Engineering, or a related field and 5+ years of work experience in an analyst role. • Database querying language(SQL) and programming language (Python) for data processing, data analysis and analytics • Advanced Excel / Google Sheet experience • Perform quantitative and statistical analysis using advanced methodologies, including linear and logistic regression and forecasting models • Strong communication skills and ability to build relationships and influence stakeholders across functional boundaries and globally • Ability to make judgments under tight deadlines and competing priorities • Experience driving collaboration of cross-functional teams, coordinating effectively, and inspiring others • Experience communicating effectively via various formats, time zones and audiences, including within operations teams and across with key stakeholders and senior leadership

title: Data Analyst
description: Job Title: Data Analyst Location: NYC, NY Duration: 12 months Job Summary: Key Responsibilities: Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into detailed technical specifications Conduct analysis of business requirements and processes for data centric projects Responsible for gathering and writing data requirements. Translate business requirements into data mapping specifications Develop a thorough understanding of the data definitions, domain values, data relationships, business rules, sources, and data integration used in the business domain Troubleshoot data issues and work with data providers for resolution Work with Data Engineers who will implement technical solutions to meet business requirements Support developers with data subject expertise Support phases of project development, from analysis and design to testing and implementation Ensure that technology solutions meet the defined requirements. Understanding of data quality and data governance Provide ongoing support and training to business users on the new or revised systems. Required Skills: Strong knowledge of relational databases and data modeling Strong SQL query skills Experience with SDLC Strong analytical, profiling and troubleshooting skills Strong knowledge with Big Data/Hadoop platform Strong business analysis and requirements definition skills Strong stakeholder presentation skills Solid organization and planning skills At least 7 years' financial industry technology experience and knowledge of financial services data Good verbal and written communication skills Desired Skills (Not required): Experience with data visualization software (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) Experience with Agile project delivery Experience with programming languages (e.g., Python)

title: Data Analyst
description: Zone IT Solutions is seeking an experienced Data Analyst with a strong background in Python and SQL. In this role, you will be responsible for gathering, processing, and analyzing large datasets, ensuring data integrity while developing actionable insights for our clients. Your ability to translate complex data findings into clear business strategies will be key to driving impactful decision-making. Requirements 3+ years of experience in data analysis or a related field Strong proficiency in Python and SQL for data manipulation and analysis Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau Ability to work with large datasets and perform data cleansing and validation Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail Strong communication skills to present insights effectively to stakeholders Benefits About Us We specialize in Digital, ERP, and larger IT Services. We offer flexible, efficient and collaborative solutions to any organization that requires IT, experts. Our agile, agnostic, and flexible solutions will help you source the IT Expertise you need. If you are looking for new opportunities, send your profile at careers.usa@zoneitsolutions.com. Also follow our LinkedIn page for new job opportunities and more. Zone IT Solutions is an equal opportunity employer and our recruitment process focuses on essential skills and abilities. We encourage applications from a diverse array of backgrounds, including individuals of various ethnicities, cultures, and linguistic backgrounds, as well as those with disabilities.

title: Data Analyst
description: Data Analyst – part time Netx is a great place to work – we think you’re going to love it here. We pride ourselves on having a great team and fun work environment while doing great work for our industry leading clients like Dick’s Sporting Goods, Conde Nast, Audible.com and others. We’ve been doing this for more than 10 years and we plan to be around for a long time. If you visit our site you’ll see we’re “Results Obsessed”. Clients hire us because we get them quality customers through the internet and we do it efficiently. They stay with us because we we’re nice people and we deliver what we promise. We’re looking for a smart, motivated Data Analyst to join our Reporting and Analytics team. When you start here we’re going to expect you to be an excel wizard with a true love for numbers and data. This position will be 2-3 days per week. If you want to join our team we want you to tell us in your cover letter or email to DataAnalyst@Netx.com how you’ll help make Netx an even better place once you’re here. Responsibilities : Assist the other analysts in collecting data and making reports client ready Review data in raw reports in Excel against reporting system data to make sure everything matches up Follow up with team members to ensure completion of tasks and projects. Learn how to use various affiliate networks and Search Engines to fetch data for reports and regular data auditing Become comfortable using Business Objects to assist in creating and modifying reports Ability to manage your tasks and time Other responsibilities may be assigned When we’re lucky enough to find our next star they’ll be showered with cool things such as flexible work hours, transit checks, all the snacks and soda you can eat, a great work environment, and an emphasis on learning. What we’re looking for: You’re nice You’re smart You’re hardworking You’re fun to work with You’re good at math You pay attention to detail and are organized You love Excel and in addition to all the basics know how to sort data, and perform vlookup, You never say “that’s not my job” You want to learn and have (or will soon have) Bachelors Degree or higher You have good ideas and aren’t afraid to share them You’re available Mondays & Tuesdays You know how to work a computer and can handle all the Microsoft programs If you have prior experience in online marketing, and/or can use SQL Query you’ve got a leg up on the competition Company Description Netx is a results-obsessed digital marketing agency based in New York City. Founded in 2001, Netx is an established leader in the area of performance marketing. Via strategic implementation of search, affiliate, display and mobile marketing, we help leading consumer brands develop profitable and sustainable customer acquisition programs. Current clients include Nickelodeon, Audible.com, Dick's Sporting Goods, Conde Nast and Red Roof Inn, among others. For more information visit: www.Netx.com.
